Posted By: greg2367 (4/15/2010 11:14:04 PM)

posts.post_content: Somehow I am very glad to see this card. Budget decks will be happy to have 8 of these. Printing viable mana fixing at the common level brings magic one step forward to being respectable as a competitive game accessible to all players valuing skill over finance. Creating Mythic Rare ensures it will never quite make it.

Posted By: HairlessThoctar (4/16/2010 10:11:04 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: This card was printed with specific intentions. Don't forget, this is directly from Wizards of the Coast: "Rise of the Eldrazi is part of Zendikar block, which means that it will be part of Zendikar Block Constructed. But it's a large set, which means that it will be drafted on its own; drafts will be either Zendikar-Zendikar-Worldwake or Rise of the Eldrazi-Rise of the Eldrazi-Rise of the Eldrazi."
posts.html:

posts.post_content: sometimes Wizard creates functional reprints to force players to buy new playsets, sometimes they do it to correct flavour or relates issues [Divination](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Divination), and sometimes they do it because they've decided to be really really nice to us. This is one of those times. x8 [Terramorphic Expanse](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Terramorphic Expanse) will really help my casual deck for 60 cents.
